title: Drawing, "Design for a Bracelet", 1800–25
medium:
Pen and brown ink, gray wash, yellow, plum watercolor
Support: white laid paper
markings: Marks: Part of a watermark: part of monogram and the "Vogheyt". Similar to Churchill 95.
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Boston
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Bracelet", 1800–25.
1800–25. Pen and brown ink, gray wash, yellow, plum watercolor
Support: white laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-693.
